channel.title: MYB
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MYB, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Billionaire VC Jim Breyer Taps Morgan Cheatham To Drive The Future Of Healthcare And Life Sciences
item.description: Morgan Cheatham, a physician-informaticist and former Bessemer VC, joins Breyer Capital to lead healthcare and life sciences at the intersection of AI...

item.title: A Rare Virga Bomb Produces Damaging Winds In Texas - What Is That?
item.description: A rare virga bomb caused 111 mph winds in Texas. What is that anyway?

item.title: How Information Can Give Companies A Competitive Advantage
item.description: Leveraging information effectively is essential for gaining a competitive advantage.

item.title: AI-Powered Decision-Making: How Intelligent Agents Are Reshaping Business Strategy
item.description: AI agents can analyze and formulate insights faster than humans—giving companies a better overview of operations, customers and market trends.

item.title: Flexible Photovoltaics: Advancing Renewable Energy Through Innovative Circuitry Solutions
item.description: The potential uses for flexible photovoltaics are essentially limitless as they progress from early-stage testing to commercial implementation.

item.title: Powerlessness
item.description: Not a lack of power, but feeling as though we have none. Some people have been indoctrinated to prefer a life with no agency, as it also brings no res...

item.title: Simple and painless productivity
item.description: On the factory floor, productivity increases are relentlessly implemented, often without regard for worker satisfaction. For people working with a lap...

item.title: Technical debt and AI slop
item.description: Technical debt is easy to incur. It’s unnecessary added features, undocumented code, support for outmoded interactions and anything that slows down yo...

item.title: Good instincts
item.description: Sometimes, in the absence of data or useful experience, we’re left to act on our instincts. It’s worth noting that other people have instincts as well...

item.title: Work ethic vs discipline
item.description: A solid work ethic drives someone to show up, even when they’d rather not. If there’s work on their desk, they’ll take it on. Discipline, on the other...
